clusters.title: What is Honduras ex-president accused of and why has Trump pardoned him?
clusters.neutral_headline: What is Honduras ex-president accused of and why has Trump pardoned him

items.title: What is Honduras ex-president accused of and why has Trump pardoned him?
items.standfirst: Juan Orlando Hernández, once called the key figure in a drug trafficking scheme that flooded America with over 400 tonnes of cocaine, walks free after the pardon.
items.content: Juan Orlando Hernández, once called the key figure in a drug trafficking scheme that flooded America with over 400 tonnes of cocaine, walks free after the pardon.

items.title: Trump frees ex-Honduran president from prison as country awaits knife-edge election result
items.standfirst: Release of convicted cocaine trafficker Juan Orlando Hernández is latest US interference in election and comes despite Trump’s apparent ‘war on drugs’Analysis: Trump’s pardon of Honduras’s ex-president shows counter-drug effort is ‘based on lies and hypocrisy’A former president of Honduras who was convicted of drug trafficking has walked free from a US prison after receiving a pardon from Donald Trump, as the country’s presidential election remained on a knife edge with the US-backed candidate leading by 515 votes.Juan Orlando Hernández, who was sentenced to 45 years in prison for allegedly creating “a cocaine superhighway to the United States”, was released from a West Virginia prison after Trump’s intervention, Hernández’s wife confirmed on Tuesday. Continue reading...
items.content: Release of convicted cocaine trafficker Juan Orlando Hernández is latest US interference in election and comes despite Trump’s apparent ‘war on drugs’Analysis: Trump’s pardon of Honduras’s ex-president shows counter-drug effort is ‘based on lies and hypocrisy’A former president of Honduras who was convicted of drug trafficking has walked free from a US prison after receiving a pardon from Donald Trump, as the country’s presidential election remained on a knife edge with the US-backed candidate leading by 515 votes.Juan Orlando Hernández, who was sentenced to 45 years in prison for allegedly creating “a cocaine superhighway to the United States”, was released from a West Virginia prison after Trump’s intervention, Hernández’s wife confirmed on Tuesday. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump follows through on vow, pardons notorious Honduran drug trafficker
items.standfirst: When Donald Trump announced the day after Thanksgiving that he intended to pardon former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández, part of me wondered if it might be a trial balloon. Maybe, I thought, the Republican president would float this as a possibility and back down soon after in the face…

items.title: Trump pardons Honduran ex-president who was convicted of drug crimes
items.standfirst: President Trump has officially pardoned former Honduran President who US officials said was at the center of one of the largest and most violent drug-trafficking conspiracies in the world.
items.content: President Trump has officially pardoned former Honduran President who US officials said was at the center of one of the largest and most violent drug-trafficking conspiracies in the world.(Image credit: Marlon Gomez/CON)

items.title: Former Honduran president released from U.S. prison after Trump pardon
items.standfirst: Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández was officially released from a U.S. prison after being pardoned by President Trump. CBS News' Nancy Cordes reports.
items.content: Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández was officially released from a U.S. prison after being pardoned by President Trump. CBS News' Nancy Cordes reports.

items.title: Juan Orlando Hernandez freed after Trump’s ‘full and complete’ pardon
items.standfirst: US President Trump defends the pardon, calling Hernandez's treatment 'harsh' and backing his political ally's party.
items.content: US President Trump defends the pardon, calling Hernandez's treatment 'harsh' and backing his political ally's party.

items.title: Trump pardons ex-Honduras president convicted of drug trafficking
items.standfirst: President Trump has pardoned the former president of Honduras, Juan Orlando Hernández, who was convicted on drug trafficking and weapons charges in 2024 and sentenced to 45 years in prison. NBC News’ George Solis reports on Trump's decision, which comes at a pivotal time for Honduras amid its own presidential election.
items.content: President Trump has pardoned the former president of Honduras, Juan Orlando Hernández, who was convicted on drug trafficking and weapons charges in 2024 and sentenced to 45 years in prison. NBC News’ George Solis reports on Trump's decision, which comes at a pivotal time for Honduras amid its own presidential election.

items.title: Putin accuses Europeans of sabotaging U.S.-led peace efforts in Ukraine
items.standfirst: Putin said the Europeans "don't have a peace agenda" and are on the side of war.
items.content: Putin said the Europeans "don't have a peace agenda" and are on the side of war.

items.title: Putin accuses Europe of blocking US efforts to end war in Ukraine
items.standfirst: Russian president says European demands ‘not acceptable’ as key talks begin in Moscow with Witkoff and KushnerRussia-Ukraine war – latest news updatesVladimir Putin has accused Europe of standing in the way of US efforts to end the war in Ukraine, as he began key talks in the Kremlin with Donald Trump’s envoy Steve Witkoff, and the US president’s son-in-law Jared Kushner.Witkoff, on his sixth trip to Moscow this year, is to present Putin with an updated version of a US peace proposal drafted with input from a senior Russian official and reworked to make it more acceptable to Kyiv. Images released through Russian state media showed the two delegations sat on opposite sides of an oval white table. Continue reading...
items.content: Russian president says European demands ‘not acceptable’ as key talks begin in Moscow with Witkoff and KushnerRussia-Ukraine war – latest news updatesVladimir Putin has accused Europe of standing in the way of US efforts to end the war in Ukraine, as he began key talks in the Kremlin with Donald Trump’s envoy Steve Witkoff, and the US president’s son-in-law Jared Kushner.Witkoff, on his sixth trip to Moscow this year, is to present Putin with an updated version of a US peace proposal drafted with input from a senior Russian official and reworked to make it more acceptable to Kyiv. Images released through Russian state media showed the two delegations sat on opposite sides of an oval white table. Continue reading...

items.title: Putin warns Europe: if you want war, then Russia will defeat you
items.standfirst: President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday warned European powers that if they started a war with Russia then Moscow was ready to fight and that the defeat of European powers would be so absolute that there would be no one left to even negotiate a peace deal. Four years into the Ukraine war, the deadliest European conflict in Europe since World War Two, Russia has failed to conquer Ukraine, a much smaller neighbour which has been supported by European powers and the United States. France24 International Affairs editor Philip Turle explains.
items.content: President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday warned European powers that if they started a war with Russia then Moscow was ready to fight and that the defeat of European powers would be so absolute that there would be no one left to even negotiate a peace deal. Four years into the Ukraine war, the deadliest European conflict in Europe since World War Two, Russia has failed to conquer Ukraine, a much smaller neighbour which has been supported by European powers and the United States. France24 International Affairs editor Philip Turle explains.

items.title: US envoy Witkoff meets Putin in Moscow for talks on Ukraine war
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin meets with US special envoy Steve Witkoff and US President Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner at the Kremlin on Tuesday for talks on the war in Ukraine. Speaking ahead of the bilateral meeting, President Volodymyr Zelensky called for negotiations to be "fair and open, so that there are no games behind Ukraine's back".
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin meets with US special envoy Steve Witkoff and US President Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner at the Kremlin on Tuesday for talks on the war in Ukraine. Speaking ahead of the bilateral meeting, President Volodymyr Zelensky called for negotiations to be "fair and open, so that there are no games behind Ukraine's back".

items.title: Mark Rutte says allies must do more to help Ukraine
items.standfirst: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte stressed the importance of the United States and Europe in advancing negotiations between Russia and Europe, but did not share any significant details about the peace plan. France 24’s International Affairs Editor Philip Turle explains.
items.content: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte stressed the importance of the United States and Europe in advancing negotiations between Russia and Europe, but did not share any significant details about the peace plan. France 24’s International Affairs Editor Philip Turle explains.

items.title: REPLAY: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte Press Conference from Brussels

items.content: Watch the replay of Pre-ministerial press conference by NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte ahead of the meeting of NATO Ministers of Foreign Affairs in Brussels, on 2 December 2025.

items.title: Putin and Trump's envoy set for key Ukraine talks in Moscow
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet US special envoy Steve Witkoff in Moscow on Tuesday, after the White House said it was "very optimistic" about reaching a deal to end the Ukraine war. US President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner, who has acted as an outside adviser in diplomatic talks, is also expected to attend. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle explains.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet US special envoy Steve Witkoff in Moscow on Tuesday, after the White House said it was "very optimistic" about reaching a deal to end the Ukraine war. US President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner, who has acted as an outside adviser in diplomatic talks, is also expected to attend. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle explains.

items.content: President Donald Trump’s special envoy is meeting Russian President Vladimir Putin Tuesday fortalks that Washington hopes will convince the Kremlin to end his war in Ukraine.

items.content: President Donald Trump says there's a “good chance” for a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine, but his negotiators have hard work ahead — they now head to the Kremlin and still need to iron out key details with Kyiv

items.title: Former EU foreign policy chief Mogherini detained in fraud probe
items.standfirst: The European Union's former top diplomat, Federica Mogherini, was taken into custody on Tuesday as “part of a probe into suspected fraud related to EU-funded training for junior diplomats”, according to a statement by the bloc's independent public prosecutor's office.
items.content: The European Union's former top diplomat, Federica Mogherini, was taken into custody on Tuesday as “part of a probe into suspected fraud related to EU-funded training for junior diplomats”, according to a statement by the bloc's independent public prosecutor's office.

items.content: Mogherini is reported to be among three in custody for suspected fraud involving an EU-funded training programme.

items.title: Former EU top diplomat among three held in fraud investigation
items.standfirst: Belgian police raid EU foreign service HQ and College of Europe and arrest Federica Mogherini and two othersBelgian police have arrested three people including the EU’s former top diplomat Federica Mogherini and raided the headquarters of the EU foreign service and the elite College of Europe as part of an investigation into suspected fraud.The three were detained “as part of a probe into suspected fraud related to EU-funded training for junior diplomats”, the European public prosecutor’s office said in a statement, without naming individuals. Continue reading...
items.content: Belgian police raid EU foreign service HQ and College of Europe and arrest Federica Mogherini and two othersBelgian police have arrested three people including the EU’s former top diplomat Federica Mogherini and raided the headquarters of the EU foreign service and the elite College of Europe as part of an investigation into suspected fraud.The three were detained “as part of a probe into suspected fraud related to EU-funded training for junior diplomats”, the European public prosecutor’s office said in a statement, without naming individuals. clusters.title: Pope prays at Beirut port blast site on last day of Lebanon visit
clusters.neutral_headline: Pope prays at Beirut port blast site on last day of Lebanon visit

items.title: Pope prays at Beirut port blast site on last day of Lebanon visit
items.standfirst: Pope Leo XIV demanded justice for the more than 200 victims of the disaster, at the end of his three-day visit to Lebanon.
items.content: Pope Leo XIV demanded justice for the more than 200 victims of the disaster, at the end of his three-day visit to Lebanon.

items.title: Pope Leo wraps up his visit to Lebanon with prayers at the site of Beirut's port blast
items.standfirst: Pope Leo XIV ended his first overseas papal trip with prayers at Beirut's devastated port and a Mass attended by 150,000 worshippers in a country desperate for signs of hope amid fear of renewed war.
items.content: Pope Leo XIV ended his first overseas papal trip with prayers at Beirut's devastated port and a Mass attended by 150,000 worshippers in a country desperate for signs of hope amid fear of renewed war.(Image credit: Adri Salido)

items.title: Pope Leo wraps up Lebanon visit with prayers at site of Beirut port blast
items.standfirst: Pope Leo’s plane has departed Beirut for Rome, marking the end of his first overseas trip as head of the Catholic Church, which included visits to Turkey and Lebanon. During the visit, he delivered a strong plea for Lebanon’s diverse communities to come together to address the country’s deep crises, speaking to tens of thousands at a Mass on Tuesday. He also urged broader peace across the region. France24 correspondent Rawad Taha reports from Beirut.
items.content: Pope Leo’s plane has departed Beirut for Rome, marking the end of his first overseas trip as head of the Catholic Church, which included visits to Turkey and Lebanon. During the visit, he delivered a strong plea for Lebanon’s diverse communities to come together to address the country’s deep crises, speaking to tens of thousands at a Mass on Tuesday. He also urged broader peace across the region. France24 correspondent Rawad Taha reports from Beirut.

items.title: Pope Leo XIV urges unity on day two of Lebanon visit
items.standfirst: Pope Leo used the second day of his visit to Lebanon to call for “coexistence,” bringing together religious leaders from both sides of the former civil war divide and urging unity in a region long scarred by conflict. Speaking in Beirut’s Martyrs’ Square, once the “green line” separating the Muslim west from the Christian east during the 1975–90 civil war, he said Lebanon stands as proof that “fear, distrust and prejudice do not have the final word.” France24 correspondent Rawad Taha reports from Beirut.
items.content: Pope Leo used the second day of his visit to Lebanon to call for “coexistence,” bringing together religious leaders from both sides of the former civil war divide and urging unity in a region long scarred by conflict. Speaking in Beirut’s Martyrs’ Square, once the “green line” separating the Muslim west from the Christian east during the 1975–90 civil war, he said Lebanon stands as proof that “fear, distrust and prejudice do not have the final word.” France24 correspondent Rawad Taha reports from Beirut.

items.content: A report finds 12 ex-police officers would have faced gross misconduct cases over the disaster under today's laws.

items.title: Hillsborough families decry ‘bitter injustice’ that no officers will face disciplinary proceedings
items.standfirst: None of the former officers named by the IOPC will face disciplinary proceedings because they have all retiredTimeline: decades seeking justice and changeThe families of those who died in the 1989 Hillsborough disaster have said it is a “bitter injustice” that no police officer will ever be held accountable for a catalogue of failings set out in the final report of the police watchdog after a 14-year investigation.The Independent Office for Police Conduct (IOPC) found that 12 police officers, most of them senior, would have faced disciplinary cases of gross misconduct if they were still serving. Continue reading...
items.content: None of the former officers named by the IOPC will face disciplinary proceedings because they have all retiredTimeline: decades seeking justice and changeThe families of those who died in the 1989 Hillsborough disaster have said it is a “bitter injustice” that no police officer will ever be held accountable for a catalogue of failings set out in the final report of the police watchdog after a 14-year investigation.The Independent Office for Police Conduct (IOPC) found that 12 police officers, most of them senior, would have faced disciplinary cases of gross misconduct if they were still serving. Continue reading...

items.title: Quarter of police forces lack basic policies on sexual offences, Sarah Everard inquiry finds
items.standfirst: The report, four years after the 33-year-old's murder, says urgent action is needed to prevent violent, sexual attacks against women.
items.content: The report, four years after the 33-year-old's murder, says urgent action is needed to prevent violent, sexual attacks against women.

items.title: Quarter of police forces missing basic policies on sexual offences, says Sarah Everard report
items.standfirst: Official report says forces in England and Wales yet to implement policies for investigationA quarter of police forces in England and Wales are yet to implement “basic policies for investigating sexual offences”, an official report has found, with women still being failed despite promises of change after the murder of Sarah Everard four years ago.The report by Dame Elish Angiolini follows an inquiry set up after Everard was murdered by a serving police officer, Wayne Couzens, in March 2021. She was abducted off a London street while walking home. Continue reading...
items.content: Official report says forces in England and Wales yet to implement policies for investigationA quarter of police forces in England and Wales are yet to implement “basic policies for investigating sexual offences”, an official report has found, with women still being failed despite promises of change after the murder of Sarah Everard four years ago.The report by Dame Elish Angiolini follows an inquiry set up after Everard was murdered by a serving police officer, Wayne Couzens, in March 2021. She was abducted off a London street while walking home. Continue reading...
